resources.string: The tile will only display the state of Battery Saver when this is on.
Toggle Battery Saver by tapping on the tile

To enable this, you\'ll need to grant the app permission to do modify system settings. To do that, connect your phone to your computer with USB debugging enabled, and issue the following command via ADB:
Once you\'ve done that, you\'ll be able to enable this setting.

Android doesn't natively support apps changing the state of Battery Saver, and as such, this feature is experimental as of now.

The workaround the app uses can cause the Android System to no longer be able to control the Battery Saver setting after tapping the tile, meaning that things like the system Battery Saver tile won't work.

If you encounter this, tapping this tile (the tile from this app) again to restore the Battery Saver setting to its previous state should fix it.
Turn this on if you only see \"Battery\" after adding the tile.
Show battery info in tile title
Set the text shown when your phone isn\'t charging
Set the text shown when your phone is charging
Customize how the tile looks and behaves
Customize the text shown on the tile
Unavailable with the settings you have enabled
When should the tile be on?

Customize the text displayed on the tile. The following placeholders can be used to display info regarding the battery on the tile:

• %%c: Current of the battery in milliamperes
• %%a: Average current of the battery in milliamperes
• %%t: Temperature of the battery in Celsius
• %%f: Temperature of the battery in Fahrenheit
• %%v: Voltage of the battery
• %%w: Wattage of the battery
• %%l: Current battery percentage

So, for example, setting the text to "Battery: %%l%%" would result in the tile displaying "Battery: 69%%".

Leaving this field blank will result in the tile displaying %1$s

Customize the text displayed on the tile. The following placeholders can be used to display info regarding the battery on the tile:

• %%c: Current of the battery in milliamperes
• %%a: Average current of the battery in milliamperes
• %%t: Temperature of the battery in Celsius
• %%f: Temperature of the battery in Fahrenheit
• %%v: Voltage of the battery
• %%w: Wattage of the battery
• %%l: Current battery percentage
• %%h: Hours until battery is charged
• %%m: Minutes until battery is charged

So, for example, setting the text to "Battery: %%l%%" would result in the tile displaying "Battery: 69%%".

Leaving this field blank will result in the tile displaying %1$s
the battery percentage and a charge time estimate.
